title: Resilient Design Tool (RDT) JSON schema
description: These schema describes the fields for the JSON schema used by the RDT Tool

critical_load_met.description: This is a number between 0 and 1 indicates the percentage of critical load that must be met in each damage scenario

total_load_met.description: This is a number between 0 and 1 indicates the percentage of non-critical load that must be met in each damage scenario

chance_constraint.description: This is a number between 0 and 1 indicates percentage of damage scenarios where the critical and total load met constraints must be met

phase_variation.description: This is a number that controls the amount of phase imbalance may occur at transformers in the system.

buses.description: This block describes the necessary bus (node) data for running an instance of RDT.

items.description: Each entry here contains information about a single bus

min_voltage.description: Minimum voltage level for the bus in p.u.

max_voltage.description: Maximum voltage level for the bus in p.u.

has_phase.description: Array indicating whether or not a bus has a phase

has_generator.description: Flag indicating whether or not the generator has a bus.

loads.description: This block describes the loads of the power system.

items.description: Each entry of the array provides information on one load.  More than one load per bus is allowed.

node_id.description: Identifier of the bus the load is attached to

has_phase.description: Array that indicates whether this load serves a phase or not

items.description: There should be three entries in this array
A 3 entry array indicating the phase real load
A 3 entry array indicating the phase reactive load.

is_critical.description: a flag indicating whether or not a load is critical or not.

lines.description: This is an array of the lines in the power system model.

items.description: Each entry contains a block containing information about a single line

node1_id.description: Identifier of the first node the line is connected to

node2_id.description: Identifier of the second the line is connected to

has_phase.description: Vector of booleans corresponding to whether of not the line carries a phase

items.description: A vector of 3 boolean values for the phases

length.description: The length of the line. Units need to be consistent with the line code entries

num_phases.description: The number of phases the line carries.

is_transformer.description: Flag indicating whether or not the line is a transformer

line_code.description: Line code identifier to get additional information about the line

construction_cost.description: The cost of constructing this line.

harden_cost.description: The cost of hardening this line.

switch_cost.description: The cost of building a switch.

is_new.description: Flag for whether or not this line is a new construction option.

can_harden.description: Flag for whether or not this line can be hardened.

can_add_switch.description: Flag for whether or not a switch can be built here

has_switch.description: Flag for whether or not a switch already exists at the line

lines_codes.description: This is an array of the line codes of the model.  This used to compactly model aspects of a line that are common across lines.  For example, impedance values.

items.description: Each entry contains a block containing information about a single line code

properties.description: Unique identifier for the line code

num_phases.description: Number of phases for the line code

rmatrix.description: An array of the resistance terms for the line (per length). The entries correspond to the rows of the rmatrix

items.description: The first entry is phase A. The second entry is phase B. The third entry is phase C

xmatrix.description: An array of the reactance terms for the line (per length). The entries correspond to the rows of the rmatrix

items.description: The first entry is phase A. The second entry is phase B. The third entry is phase C

generators.description: This block describes the generators in the model.

items.description: Each entry of this array contains information about one generator in the model.  More than one generator can exist at a bus

node_id.description: identifier of the bus the generator is connected to

has_phase.description: Array of flags indicating whether or not a generator has a phase or not

max_real_phase.description: Existing maximum real power output of the generator for each phase

max_reactive_phase.description: Existing maximum raective power output of the generator for each phase

microgrid_cost.description: Cost per MW capacity of building (additional) distributed generation, i.e. expanded capacity

microgrid_fixed_cost.description: One-time fixed cost for building (additional) distributed generation, i.e. expanded capacity

max_microgrid.description: Maximum additional capacity that can be built at this generator.

is_new.description: Flag indicating whether or not new generation can be built

scenarios.description: This block contains information about the damage scenarios

items.description: Each entry in the array contains information about a single damage scenario

id.description: A unique identifier for the scenario

hardened_disabled_lines.description: A list of identifiers for lines that are damaged even after being hardened

disabled_lines.description: A list of identifiers for lines that are damaged if they are not hardened
